radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal dependent atelectasis at the lung bases. No focal pulmonary nodule or mass. No pleural effusion. The appendix is minimally dilated measuring up to 7 to 8 mm with mild fat stranding and fascial thickening along the lateral margin of the appendix and extending along the lateral cecum. No appendicolith. The cecum appears decompressed with surrounding inflammation. The stomach and small bowel loops are normal in caliber. The rectum and colon besides the cecum are normal. No pelvic free fluid. No pathologically enlarged pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes. No bone destructive lesion or acute fracture.
